string.text: Heavy Pockets
Traders are more willing to sell higher tier gear to you, even if you don't meet the goodwill requirements with their faction.
Your wealth has become legendary among the traders of the Zone. Eager for your patronage, they're more likely to offer their best wares to you, regardless of your standing with their faction.
You have unlocked the "Heavy Pockets" achievement.
Radiotherapy
When a psy-storm or emission begins, there's a chance you won't require shelter for its duration.
Strangely, part of your mind has suddenly fallen silent, and you no longer fear the approach of emissions or psy-storms. In fact, you now feel an odd sort of peace upon their arrival.
You have unlocked the "Radiotherapy" achievement.
Infopreneur
Brokers will now pay you a small additional bonus for any future PDA you deliver to them.
Whether selling or buying, to many people information is just as valuable as artefacts. Having learned this through experience, you're able to charge more for the secrets you sell.
You have unlocked the "Infopreneur" achievement.
Duga Free
Stalkers are more likely to try access the paths through Yantar and Radar.

After seeing what reckless experimentation has brought to the Zone, you have taken action into your own hands. Paths through Yantar and Radar are now open since disabling the Miracle Machine and Brain Scorcher.
You have unlocked the "Duga Free" achievement.
Well Dressed
You are able to skin mutants much faster than normal.
Rightly so does the Zone's wildlife fear you - more than a fair share have fallen at your hands. Practiced hands make for swift work, and you've grown practiced indeed.
You have unlocked the "Well Dressed" achievement.
Silver or Lead
Surrendering stalkers may occasionally reveal the location of a second stash.

Bodies and bullet casings litter the tracks behind you. You have been cruel to your enemies, and through your cruelty they know who you are. Those who survive your horrifying onslaughts are now much more willing to part with their goods if it means living to see another day.
You have unlocked the "Silver or Lead" achievement.
Mechanized Warfare
Bonus items used in repairs are more effective.
Grateful for your diligent assistance, the technician you've helped kit out has decided to teach you a thing or two about field maintenance, allowing you to make more efficient repairs yourself.
You have unlocked the "Mechanized Warfare" achievement.
Tourist
Your keen familiarity with the Zone has allowed you to deduce the whereabouts of some of its best stashes.

Despite the dangers, you have explored all accessible parts of the Zone. From the murky depths of the Great Swamp to the metal maze of the Truck Cemetery - you know the Zone like the back of your hand.
You have unlocked the "Tourist" achievement.
Rag and Bone
Your luck with future stashes has slightly increased.
What's theirs is yours, or so you like to think. You have a knack for finding other people's stashes. Despite some misfortune here and there, you feel that for the most part your luck is improving.
You have unlocked the "Rag and Bone" achievement.
Completionist
All available achievements have been unlocked.

All there is to achieve has been achieved. You know the Zone better than the Zone knows itself. And despite all odds being stacked against you, and every threat you've faced - you still remain undefeated.
You have unlocked the "Completionist" achievement.
Wishful Thinking
You've unlocked "Renegades" as a playable faction.

You did whatever it took to obtain secret knowledge from one of the eldest stalkers in the Zone. While you're skeptical he revealed the whole truth to you, what you accomplished in the quest for knowledge cannot be denied.
You have unlocked the "Wishful Thinking" achievement.
Down to Earth
Mi-2 helicopters will appear in place of Mi-24s.
The higher they fly the harder they fall. Not willing to waste any more expensive equipment, the Zone's helicopters now seem to be of a much weaker variety. But are no less tempting to destroy.
You have unlocked the "Down to Earth" achievement.
Geologist
Artefacts have an increased chance of respawning.

Humming, buzzing and spitting - the anomalies of the Zone do not scare you any longer. After so many successful endeavours, you can't help but notice that artefacts seem more numerous than ever before.
You have unlocked the "Geologist" achievement.
Patriarch
You can recruit more stalkers as companions.

Your exploits throughout the Zone have become legendary. You now carry a confidence and sense of leadership that only immense experience can bring. Whether deliberately or subconsciously, you know how to get others to follow you into the mouth of hell...and back out again.
You have unlocked the "Patriarch" achievement.
Bookworm Food
Memory sticks will be replaced by rare PDAs when spawned.
Through your own endeavours or by reading about those of others, you have come to learn a lot about the Zone and its many inhabitants. Perhaps you should consider sharing some of this knowledge?
You have unlocked the "Bookworm Food" achievement.
Infantile Pleasure
Your luck with finding items inside boxes has slightly increased.

Whether you're on an important mission or wasting time, boxes were never safe from your actions. You have since elevated box breaking to an art form, cracking them open with minimal damage to the contents within.
You have unlocked the "Infantile Pleasure" achievement.
Recycler
For every item you disassemble, there is a little chance of acquiring an extra material.

Believing that every part counts, you cannot help but break down what you don't want to use back into its base components. After much experience, you have become more precise. Dismantling has never been easier.
You have unlocked the "Recycler" achievement.
Artificer Eagerness
Crafting requires one or two less components.
Crafting your own equipment has always been an empowering process, but now your increased experience in the matter has allowed you use your components with greater efficiency.
You have unlocked the "Artificer Eagerness" achievement.
Unforeseen Guest
You are less likely to appear suspicious or be discovered while disguised.

Thanks to your stealth and observational skills, your disguises are more convincing. Because of this, you are able to stand in plain sight amongst your enemies with much greater confidence, knowing that - with the appropriate apparel - their prying eyes are less likely to focus on you.
You have unlocked the "Unforeseen Guest" achievement.
Absolver
You've unlocked "Sin" as a playable faction.
When the dark stalkers of Sin stepped forth to bring their vision upon the world, you stood against them, giving the world a chance to sort itself out without the manipulation of the noosphere.
You have unlocked the "Absolver" achievement.
Collaborator
You've unlocked "UNISG" as a playable faction.
For better or worse, you chose your side and made your decision. It's hard to tell if you were wrong or right...but you made it. And one guesses you should be thankful for that.
You have unlocked the "Collaborator" achievement.
Iron Curtain
You have been awarded a 50,000 RU bonus for your contribution to the faction's war effort.

Your faction has become an indisputable force within the Zone, with some lesser groups even considering it a local superpower. Some of the vast resources that are now at your faction's disposal are sure to come your way soon.
You have unlocked the "Iron Curtain" achievement.
Murky Spirit
Your rank has been greatly increased.
You have soundly survived events that would've killed most stalkers several times over. Some stalkers are beginning to wonder if you can even be killed at all.
You have unlocked the "Murky Spirit" achievement.
Invictus
You can now take a screenshot and brag about this achievement to your fellow stalkers.

Despite the challenges, trials and vicissitudes thrown your way, you have proven yourself to be a resounding success. It is clear that there is nothing left in the Zone to challenge you, and that it may be time - perhaps with a twinge of sadness - to move onto even greater things.
You have unlocked the "Invictus" achievement.
